label: Behavior 59808147
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 58.2884 + 0.00072 × t + 0.00001 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.7048 + 0.00084 × t + 0.00002 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed of approximately 14.8–14.9 knots across the trajectory)

Course change: gradual and consistent (COG varies slightly between 29.7° and 31.5°, showing a smooth oscillation around a mean course of ~30.5°, indicating minor corrective steering or channel following)
Heading fluctuation: gradual and consistent (heading remains fixed at 32.0° throughout, suggesting autopilot mode with small rudder adjustments to maintain alignment with the desired track)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 58.2884 + 0.00072 × t + 0.00001 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.7048 + 0.00084 × t + 0.00002 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
